t: The*p Lord*s is my light and my salvation; whom shall I fear? the Lord*s is the strength of my life; of whom shall I be afraid?
When*p the wicked, even mine enemies and my foes, came upon me to eat up my flesh, they stumbled and fell.
Though*p an host should encamp against me, my heart shall not fear: though war should rise against me, in this will I be confident.

One*p thing have I desired of the Lord,*s that will I seek after; that I may dwell in the house of the Lord*s all the days of my life, to behold the beauty of the Lord,*s and to enquire in his temple.
For*p in the time of trouble he shall hide me in his pavilion: in the secret of his tabernacle shall he hide me; he shall set me up upon a rock.
And*p now shall mine head be lifted up above mine enemies round about me: therefore will I offer in his tabernacle sacrifices of joy; I will sing, yea, I will sing praises unto the Lord.*s
Hear,*p O Lord,*s when I cry with my voice: have mercy also upon me, and answer me.
When*p thou saidst, Seek ye my face; my heart said unto thee, Thy face, Lord,*s will I seek.
Hide*p not thy face far from me; put not thy servant away in anger: thou hast been my help; leave me not, neither forsake me, O God of my salvation.
When*p my father and my mother forsake me, then the Lord*s will take me up.
Teach*p me thy way, O Lord,*s and lead me in a plain path, because of mine enemies.
Deliver*p me not over unto the will of mine enemies: for false witnesses are risen up against me, and such as breathe out cruelty.
I*p had fainted, unless I had believed to see the goodness of the Lord*s in the land of the living.
Wait*p on the Lord:*s be of good courage, and he shall strengthen thine heart: wait, I say, on the Lord.*s
